publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments-That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue.

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments-That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue.
S1M-831# Allotments (lodged on 10 May 2000) Robert Brown*
S1M-831# Allotments (lodged on 10 May 2000) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments—That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue. Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-831# Allotments (lodged on 10 May 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments—That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue. Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments-That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue. Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie
S1M-831# Allotments (lodged on 10 May 2000) Brian Adam*

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments-That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue. Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Brian Adam
S1M-831# Allotments (lodged on 10 May 2000) Fergus Ewing*

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments—That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue. Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Brian Adam, Fergus Ewing

S1M-831# Robin Harper: Allotments—That the Parliament believes that the problems facing allotment holders throughout Scotland in relation to tenure should be investigated and that a policy to protect and preserve allotment holdings throughout Scotland, particularly in Edinburgh, should be developed and calls upon the Scottish Executive to report to the Parliament on this issue. Supported by: Robert Brown, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Brian Adam, Fergus Ewing
